thread.title: Liam Gallagher to reunite with Noel for Oasis sequel
thread.title_full: Liam Gallagher to reunite with Noel for Oasis sequel

title: Liam Gallagher to reunite with Noel for Oasis sequel
text:
GETTY BIG PLANS: Liam wants to do another documentary 
Last year, the 44-year-old teamed up with his brother Noel to release Oasis documentary Supersonic - covering the launch of their career up to the height of their success in the mid 90s. 
Now director Mat Whitecross has let slip Liam hopes to cash in on the film's success. 
Chatting at the Empire Awards after picking up the award for Best Documentary, Mat said: " Liam and Noel Gallagher were really generous. 
GETTY WINNER: Director Mat with the award 
"Everything we asked for they gave us." 
Revealing a second Oasis documentary could be just around he corner, he continued: "Liam said he wants to make a sequel. 
"I don't know if he was joking or not." Oasis in pictures Wednesday, 10th August 2016 When Oasis released their second album (What's the Story) Morning Glory? it went on to sell over 22,000,000 copies worldwide. We look back at the band's turbulent career in pictures. 1 / 54 Getty Images Liam and Noel Gallagher from Oasis at a press conference held in the Water Rats pub in London, August 25, 1999 
GETTY LAUNCH: Liam at the premiere of Supersonic in London 
Pausing, he added: "Actually after we cut Knebworth Liam and Noel both actually said they wanted to carry on." 
Though, fans better not hold their breath. 
The brothers are known for for their volatile relationship - with Liam even taking a swipe at Noel during the documentary's premiere last October. 
GETTY SUPORT: Liam and Noel were hands on with the project 
As his brother failed to arrive, Liam ranted: "He does what he does and I do what I do. 
"I guess he'll be there if it wins an award though, won't he? 
GETTY NO SHOW: Noel didn't turn up to the premiere last year 
"This probably ain't f***ing A-list enough for him." 
However, despite the win neither of the brothers were seen at the Empire Awards â€“ instead leaving it to the film'sproduction crew to take home the gong. Related articles
